Primitive Types

There are several primitive types defined in tjsTypes.h.

tjs_int
Signed integer (minimum 32-bit)
tjs_uint
Unsigned integer (minimum 32-bit)
tjs_int8
8-bit signed integer
tjs_uint8
8-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int16
16-bit signed integer
tjs_uint16
16-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int32
32-bit signed integer
tjs_uint32
32-bit unsigned integer
tjs_int64
64-bit signed integer
tjs_uint64
64-bit unsigned integer
tjs_char
Wide character (used as a primitive type for the TJS2 string type)
tjs_nchar
Narrow character
tjs_real
Real number type (double)
tTVInteger
Same as tjs_int64
tTVReal
Same as tjs_real

tTJSString

The tTJSString type is the string type used in TJS2, handling null-terminated strings of the tjs_char type. It is defined in tjsString.cpp / tjsString.h. It can also be used via the shorter type name ttstr.
In addition to automatically managing memory for strings, this type has high compatibility with the tTJSVariant type.

eTJS

The eTJS type is the base type for C++ exception objects. It is defined in tjsError.h. It has a method called GetMessage, which allows you to retrieve the message string thrown with the exception.

TJS_W

A macro for converting string literals to the tjs_char * type.

Example: TJS_W("string literal")
